title: Planned Carbon Change
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "1c4af583-4019-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=1c4af583-4019-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Planned Carbon Change", "description": "Dear Mr. McCabe,

Following on from our earlier conversation I am writing to inform the Agency that both the facility manager Mr. Pat Lynch and myself noted the sweet carbon smell coming from the odour abatement system earlier today.  This smell is associated with depleting carbon in the abatement system.  As such, weather permitting the carbon in the Odour abatement system will be changed in the coming days.  As is the normal practice we will carry out daily AG5's until the carbon has been changed.

I will provide a follow up notification when we began the process of changing the carbon.

Regards,

Ben Frost 
South Dublin County Council", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "1c4af583-4019-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR093576", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "08c9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "ac2d08e5-ca30-4db3-8dfa-02e6afc73ba1", "datereceived": "2025-04-14T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-26T00:00:00", "title": "Planned Carbon Change", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Mr. McCabe,\r\n\r\nFollowing on from our earlier conversation I am writing to inform the Agency that both the facility manager Mr. Pat Lynch and myself noted the sweet carbon smell coming from the odour abatement system earlier today.  This smell is associated with depleting carbon in the abatement system.  As such, weather permitting the carbon in the Odour abatement system will be changed in the coming days.  As is the normal practice we will carry out daily AG5's until the carbon has been changed.\r\n\r\nI will provide a follow up notification when we began the process of changing the carbon.\r\n\r\nRegards,\r\n\r\nBen Frost \r\nSouth Dublin County Council", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Civic Amenity closed for the day.
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "2f9d8b57-3919-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=2f9d8b57-3919-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Civic Amenity closed for the day.", "description": "Dear Mr. McCabe,

I wish to inform the Agency that a decision was made to close the Civic Amenity site at lunchtime today due to the failure of a hydraulic ram on the Grab machine servicing the civic amenity earlier this morning.

Following the breakdown, MSW from the Civic Amenity site was transferred to the baling shed. The machine has since been repaired, and we are currently in the process of emptying the remaining material containers.

Normal operations at the Civic Amenity site are expected to resume tomorrow.

Regards,

Ben Frost.
South Dublin County Council", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "2f9d8b57-3919-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR093569", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "08c9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "ac2d08e5-ca30-4db3-8dfa-02e6afc73ba1", "datereceived": "2025-04-14T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-26T00:00:00", "title": "Civic Amenity closed for the day.", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Mr. McCabe,\r\n\r\nI wish to inform the Agency that a decision was made to close the Civic Amenity site at lunchtime today due to the failure of a hydraulic ram on the Grab machine servicing the civic amenity earlier this morning.\r\n\r\nFollowing the breakdown, MSW from the Civic Amenity site was transferred to the baling shed. The machine has since been repaired, and we are currently in the process of emptying the remaining material containers.\r\n\r\nNormal operations at the Civic Amenity site are expected to resume tomorrow.\r\n\r\nRegards,\r\n\r\nBen Frost.\r\nSouth Dublin County Council", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Completion notice mid-April ploughing
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "9191a53d-a722-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=9191a53d-a722-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Completion notice mid-April ploughing", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam,

As per Condition 6.10 of Dumping at Sea Permit S0012-03, Port of Waterford hereby notifies the Environmental Protection Agency that we have completed our mid-April maintenance ploughing campaign (15th - 19th April). The areas worked were Cheekpoint Lower Bar and Cheekpoint Access Channel. 

The High Water tides during the campaign were as follows:

15th April – 4.3m 
16th April  – 4.3m
17th April  – 4.2m
18th April  – 4.0m
19th April – 3.9m 

Sincerely,
Ian Moriarty", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "9191a53d-a722-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR093920", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "a315b192-5ad4-42b7-a167-962202f5e2f8", "licenceprofileid": "d3e61a83-98a6-e611-8d41-0050568a69e2", "datereceived": "2025-04-26T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-04-28T00:00:00", "title": "Completion notice mid-April ploughing", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam,\r\n\r\nAs per Condition 6.10 of Dumping at Sea Permit S0012-03, Port of Waterford hereby notifies the Environmental Protection Agency that we have completed our mid-April maintenance ploughing campaign (15th - 19th April). The areas worked were Cheekpoint Lower Bar and Cheekpoint Access Channel. \r\n\r\nThe High Water tides during the campaign were as follows:\r\n\r\n15th April \u2013 4.3m \r\n16th April  \u2013 4.3m\r\n17th April  \u2013 4.2m\r\n18th April  \u2013 4.0m\r\n19th April \u2013 3.9m \r\n\r\nSincerely,\r\nIan Moriarty", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "63782a9f-def6-4c0f-ae57-6111cafbce99", "document_type": "Meeting", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/MeetingCorrespondence/meetingbyid?meeting_id=63782a9f-def6-4c0f-ae57-6111cafbce99", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"meetingid\": \"63782a9f-def6-4c0f-ae57-6111cafbce99\", \"type\": \"Meeting\", \"reference\": \"MTG000747\", \"subject\": \"P0738-03, Vermilion waste management meeting\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"meetingdate\": \"2025-04-07T00:00:00\", \"organisationid\": \"f878ad2c-b276-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"location\": \"MS Teams\", \"regarding\": \"Other\", \"meetingtime\": \"11:15\", \"attendeesepa\": \"Mick Henry - Regional Manager\\nKealan Reynolds - Team Lead / Inspector\\nCatherine Organo - Radiation Protection Regulation Inspector\\nIsabel Kerins - Inspector\", \"attendeesnoepa\": \"Catriona King - Environmental Advisor\\nVincent Lang - Laboratory Team Lead\\nTony Reilly - Production Manager\\nDavina Burke - Health and Safety Manager\", \"actionitems\": \"

This meeting was held to discuss the licensee progress on finalising suitable disposal / recovery options available to them with regards to the on-site naturally occurring radiological material (NORM) waste being stored at the site. 

\", \"licenceid\": \"2e08f37a-e7c6-42d4-8ca0-b6e18b31a399\", \"originalmeetingid\": \"37f2bf54-5915-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"organisationname\": \"Vermilion Exploration and Production Ireland Limited\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "e358a7b7-3e95-4d9e-847e-083d12a87219", "document_type": "Meeting", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/MeetingCorrespondence/meetingbyid?meeting_id=e358a7b7-3e95-4d9e-847e-083d12a87219", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"meetingid\": \"e358a7b7-3e95-4d9e-847e-083d12a87219\", \"type\": \"Meeting\", \"reference\": \"MTG000746\", \"subject\": \"Ringsend WWTP upgrade project update from Uisce \\u00c9ireann\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"meetingdate\": \"2025-04-07T00:00:00\", \"organisationid\": \"f5545f77-3749-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"location\": \"Online MS Teams\", \"regarding\": \"Compliance Investigations\", \"meetingtime\": \"12:00\", \"attendeesepa\": \"Lorcan Farrell, Stephen McCarthy, David Shannon\", \"attendeesnoepa\": \"Uisce \\u00c9ireann: Ringsend WWTP Upgrade Project Team, Compliance Team & Asset Operations\\n\", \"actionitems\": \"

A video conference meeting was held between the EPA and Uisce Éireann (UÉ) on 08/04/2025 from 12:00 to 12:50 approx.

\\n

During the meeting UÉ gave an update to the EPA on the phased upgrades being undertaken at Ringsend WWTP and a summary of treatment plant performance for Q1 2025.

\\n

Works on Hybrid II upgrades and sludge treatment facilities are progressing as scheduled with all primary aspects of the upgrade project due for completion by end 2025. A programme of ancillary works connected with the overall upgrade project is also being progressed with most completion dates falling within 2025.

\\n

A summary of plant performance was given. UÉ are aiming for 104 compliance samples to be taken during 2025. 10 no. samples records were recorded in the Q1 Update under compliance investigation (CI000025).  Compliance results were unavailable for the first three weeks of January. This was attributed to operational reasons (plant shutdowns) and management changeover. It is UÉ’s intention to make up the shortfall to 104 compliance samples over the year. It was acknowledged that there is a risk that TN and TP average limits may not be achieved this year. UÉ expect that performance will improve across all parameters once remaining upgraded SBR blocks come back on-line and as average air temperatures increase through the year. UÉ confirmed that higher than expected load on the plant (2.17 PE in 2024) was expected to continue increasing in 2025 and is also affecting treatment performance. Issues with the aeration system in the Capital Upgrade treatment block were also cited as a compounding factor in treatment performance and should be resolved by end April 2025.

\\n

The EPA instructed Uisce Éireann to carry out all actions necessary to comply with the waste water discharge licence.

\", \"licenceid\": \"4ab24fc5-2bf8-4aa8-ad9e-f4f68c559186\", \"originalmeetingid\": \"0d83b2ed-7614-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"organisationname\": \"Uisce \\u00c9ireann\"}"}

title: VC into SDS Cleanroom
document_type: Requests for Approval and Site Reports
metadata_json: {"compliance_id": "95c742bb-6711-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=95c742bb-6711-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "VC into SDS Cleanroom", "description": "The following change is being implemented onsite to utilise an existing Clean Room (SDS) with Vessel Closure operations. The change will involve a re-layout to be executed in the current Vessel Closure suites to improve manufacturing efficiency. This change will need to be implemented from May-2025 to Jul-2026, to remove Vessel Closure products manufacturing constraints in Abbott Vascular Clonmel with minimum impact to customer supply. {"compliance_id": "e7c16538-43e3-47d6-823f-b6cb2cc8c246", "document_type": "Meeting", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/MeetingCorrespondence/meetingbyid?meeting_id=e7c16538-43e3-47d6-823f-b6cb2cc8c246", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"meetingid\": \"e7c16538-43e3-47d6-823f-b6cb2cc8c246\", \"type\": \"Meeting\", \"reference\": \"MTG000742\", \"subject\": \"P0801-03: Tipperary Co-Op Compliance Meeting\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"meetingdate\": \"2025-03-06T00:00:00\", \"organisationid\": \"5c83ffb3-458d-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"location\": \"Tipperary Co-Op Site\", \"regarding\": \"Compliance Investigations\", \"meetingtime\": \"11:00\", \"attendeesepa\": \"Pamela McDonald - Programme Manager \\nIrene Doyle - Senior Inspector \\nBilly Shanahan - Inspector \", \"attendeesnoepa\": \"John Hunter - Tipperary Co-Op Site Manager \\nSe\\u00e1n Hennebry - Tipperary Co-Op EHS Graduate\\nTony Motherway - Tipperary Co-Op Engineer \\nKevin Sheehan - Consultant \\nPeadar O'Loughlin - Consultant \\nJason McAndrew - Arrabawn Project Manager \\nShane Mulcahy - Arrabawn Maintenance Manager \", \"actionitems\": \"

A discussion was held regarding the outstanding issues on site and the proposed timeframes on addressing these issues.

\\n

Tipperary Co-Op site manager gave an update on the merger with Arrabawn being completed and that there would be a new structure confirmed in the next couple of weeks. This new structure will be submitted to the EPA upon finalisation.

\\n

The site manager handed over to their consultant to give a presentation on the site history, the projects undertaken in conjunction with the EPA licence and the actions to be undertaken to resolve the historical compliance issues and projects to improve site efficiency.

\\n

The Programme Manager then spoke about the length of time given to the licensee to date to address issues on site and that the site has been on the EPA’s National Priority Sites list since 2021 and the ongoing legal action taken by the EPA. The licensee was instructed to give a letter of commitment that all issues outstanding will be addressed. This letter is to be signed by the licensee’s Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Chairperson and Treasurer. The letter is to be submitted by Licensee Returns on EDEN within 2 weeks.

\\n

The Programme Manager also expressed their concern of the risk the site poses to the River Ara, that they are a significant pressure on the waterbody achieving good status by 2027. Furthermore, the Programme Manager indicated that they intend on visiting the site again should matters not improve.        

\\n

A site inspection followed and is detailed in Site Visit Ref. No. SV32398.
